intro: Adenocline pauciflora var. cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf adenocline, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, cuneate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
